alert.note: Alert for Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 10 at 6:39PM MDT until May 10 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Washington County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 639 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles southwest of Akron, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Akron around 650 PM MDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
